# miniwindowTitle

**Instance Property**

The title displayed in the window’s minimized window.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var miniwindowTitle: String! { get set }
```

## Discussion

A minimized window’s title usually reflects that of its full-size counterpart, abbreviated to fit if necessary. Although this property allows you to set the minimized window’s title explicitly, changing the full-size `NSWindow` object’s title (through [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/title] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/setTitleWithRepresentedFilename(_:)]) automatically changes the minimized window’s title as well.

## Minimizing Windows

- **isMiniaturized**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the window is minimized.
- **performMiniaturize(_:)**: Simulates the user clicking the minimize button by momentarily highlighting the button, then minimizing the window.
- **miniaturize(_:)**: Removes the window from the screen list and displays the minimized window in the Dock.
- **deminiaturize(_:)**: De-minimizes the window.
- **miniwindowImage**: The custom miniaturized window image of the window.
